reviewText:
5min of gameplay
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9_D3pwbr_Js

If you don't know this is a match 3 of a like color game.
Balls or squares are tossed to the center of the board and you try to match 3 or more like colors.
Some levels you can just click to destroy matches but most will need you to draw lines over them.
There are also pinball (boss?) levels where you need to get 3 balls in holes on the left and right sides.
This game also has power ups.
On the right you have an sword, axe and 2 rockets and after selecting them you can throw them to destroy balls.
On the right are balls you can drop in, fire (burns balls it touches), fusion (turns balls into like colors it touches), electroball (shoots out lightning to destroy balls), bomb (explodes after a bit removing balls)
The levels do change thing up with the way balls are drops or placed so if your into match 3 games this is definitely feels different though less refined.

reviewText:
I usually try to be more verbose in these, or explain myself, but this game basically deserves little more than it's hot trash".

It's hot trash!

A few creative board patterns does not excuse some banal gameplay on a timer which gives almost nil for feedback and doesn't ever improve or shake up a basic pattern of "click
recommended: click" in any way. Skill barely comes into play. This is like match-3 pachinko."

reviewText:
I've got this game in an old Indie Royale bundle. I'm not used to playing match 3 games. I can say, having played 9 levels, that I find this game good enough for the asking price. It's not great by any means, but it's fun enough if you want something cheap and casual.

Pros:

- Some creative levels
- Easy to pick up and play
- cheap

Cons:

- Repetitive
- Having to play the same level more than once (not sure why, the game blocks the next level when I finish the current one)
- 4:3 screen size, no option to change resolution
- sound design is very basic and a bity annoying
- Sometimes drawing a line fails, and it's not the player's fault (room for improvement)

All things considered, I'd give this game a 6/10 (mediocre). Grab it on a bundle or in a sale, and it's likely you're not going to regret it.

reviewText: Fun game to play. Very good physics, which is important for that kind of games, many levels to play, simple gameplay. Didn't liked background images on some levels, little bit distracting to me, but thats okay, if you're into the game.\nDefinitely worth the your money to spend
I love this game so much <3
This is a good indie game) The game has 100 levels and each becomes more and more difficult, but it is very interesting) and the soundtrack of the game simply gorgeous)\nI recommend)\n

Addictive, but repetitive game.

Pros:

+ Tricky levels
+ Easy to learn
+ Cheap
+ Good graphics (for this genre)

Cons:
- No achievements
- Bad sounds
- Too repetitive

Good game for playing 1 hour per day.

reviewText:
Oh my. This game is garbage. It looks like complete trash. It's interface is ugly as hell. In windowed mode it loses focus sometimes because mouse pointer is not locked... Also the FPS are kinda small on my AMD FX4300 / Radeon R9 380 in windowed mode.

But hey, it IS fun! It's a match 3 / draw a line / pinball game. I've just spent 15 minutes of my lifetime on it and I gonna definitely play this again later.

I got mine for free on one of those Sell your soul and get a random steam game
date: you crazy addict" deals so not complaining. The game is funny and playable (even tho it looks like lowquality crap). Would be an awesome
recommended: super-duper game if it came out 15 years ago. And has been free.\n\nAnyway definitely recommend. IS a good timekiller."

reviewText:
I bought this. Why, I don't know, but I DID buy it...
I bought a fart.
I don't remember how I got this game, but at some point I had to purchase it. Probably on a sale when it was like 14 cents or something like that. I can say that I got about 14 cents of enjoyment out of it.

Picture this if you will:

I played the first level. It worked fine and I found it enjoyable. At first startup the game crashed really hard and I had to close and reopen it. I then found the clicking to be an enjoyable exercise even though the graphics sucked.

Level 2:

Didn't work. Playing a match 3 game, where you're supposed to match 3, and click on them to make them disappear. Didn't work. Had a collection of as many as 20 little colored balls that I was clicking on, and those things didn't disappear. That's when I noticed that there was a circling mechanic. Great! Now I know how to play the level!

And that fat jerk mechanic still didn't work.

I got one level. one level of crap. I wouldn't say this game took a big dump on the world of casual gaming, but it definitely farted on it. I paid for a fart game. A stupid, stupid, farty game.

reviewText:
hello everybody its me payde fore the clown! by day i ride around in the woodlandfaerietruck, and by night i search for the best games on steam! i am happy to say that today i have found one that is amazing! get excited! go make mom and dad breakfast in bed! climb a tree! don't forget come back and finish reading!

this game is called match 3 revolution, probably because it revolutionizes the genre.  have you ever wanted to play match 3 underwater? how about on the moon? this game has it all and does it better than anyone else ever in recorded human history! let me tell you friends, i played this game and then watched the cow jump over the moon, and the game was more exciting! steaming hot oh wow oh wow oh wow!

in closing, i rate this game 14 stars out of 5 on the scale of goodness. highly recommended for humans and robots. animals can join in the fun, but may find the later levels a bit too challenging.

thanks for reading another payde fore review. feel free to check out the new payde fore curations group at http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PAYDEFORE for more games that have payde fore approval!
